beans.description:
This (contrived) adaptor does the following...
* reads lines from multiple input files * converts delmited input into maps * writes to stdout
This example is designed to illustrate the basic structure of an adaptor router configuration which fans in from several data sources (ReadConnectors) to a single output stage.
This example illustrates the linkage between components using a processMap within Router.
Note that the order of input from the various sources is not defined.
It may be run as follows:
java org.openadaptor.spring.SpringAdaptor -config fanin.xml
The classpath should include the following
lib lib/openadaptor.jar lib/openadaptor-spring.jar lib/openadaptor-depends.jar

bean.description: This is the bean that actually gets run.
The adaptor delegates it's message processing to a router. The router uses this mapping to define the "processing pipeline".
This is a processor that converts delimited strings into an ordered map.
This is a write connector that outputs the data to a stream (stdout).
